fields.description:
When I initiate a HTTP request to the REST API with wrong username/password, JIRA will report 2 failed login attempts per HTTP request.

That is bad, because after 3 failed login attempts (that is the default) JIRA will no longer accept any requests (even those with correct username/password) but locks the account requiring
* either the user to log out and log in again, entering a CAPTCHA
* or the administrator to reset failed login attempts counter in User management

{noformat}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:9000/rest/api/2/search?jql=assignee=fred
{noformat}

Reproduced on different development (SDK, 6.4) and standalone (local, 6.4 and 6.4.7) instances on two machines.
fields.summary: Unauthenticated REST request results in two failed login attempts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44277].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating too many issue security issues can create some serious performance issues within JIRA. Limit or at least warning the customer that they are about to run into this issue when creating more than the recommend number of Issue Security Levels within the product could prevent customers from making an implementation decision that causes negative performance impacts within their environment and a poor experience of JIRA.

h3. Environment
JIRA + Many Issue Security Levels.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Many Issue Security Levels as per: [Configuring Issue-level Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security]
# Exceed the recommended limit of ten Issue Security Levels.
# Observe degradation of JIRA performance as a result of this.

h3. Expected Results
We should _at least_ warn the customer that using too many issue security levels will potentially impact JIRA performance, and if possible implement both soft and hard limits on the number of issue security levels that can be created. There could also be the possibility of allowing these values to be set with flags so that the limitation can be knowingly breached. 

h3. Actual Results
The current implementation relies on customers reading the recent versions of the Documentation that highlight this performance issue. This doesn't work for a few reasons:
- Users that are 'old hat' or confident with the product functionality might not consult the documentation.
- User that have implemented one or two issue security levels, my erroneously think the feature can support many more levels without consulting the documentation
- Users that are finding the functionality might not consult the documentation.
fields.summary: Create Limits and Warnings on too many Issue Security Levels
People and Dates Section Should Always be Visible Even Scrolling Down

fields.description:
h3. Description
When a context path is configured on JIRA, the Release Notes page is not loaded and a 404 error is returned. It happens because the Release Notes link is configured to use a "/jira" context path instead of the correct one on the Base URL.
This is not reproducible when a context path is not set or is set to "/jira".

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Configure a custom context path for JIRA, other than "/jira".
# Go to [Release Notes creation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Release+Notes]
# Page returns a 404 error.

h3. Work-around

* Configure the JIRA context path to be "/jira" or remove it.
* If using a proxy, use a re-write rule to change {{<base_url>/jira/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa}} to {{<base_url>/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa}}.
fields.summary: Release notes link does not respect context path configuration

fields.description:
When I try to change type of my issue into a different type, I can see a list of projects in the 'Issue type' select box. This list is a comma separated, alphabetically sorted list of first couple of projects that are mapped to the same issue type scheme as the project that contains current issue that is being changed to a new type. The list also ends with ellipsis.

Issue type select box should not contain such information since customers that are able to change issue types should not be able to see what other projects our organization is working on.

There is no way to prevent our customers from seeing this, apart from creating different issue type scheme per each project or not allowing customers to change issue types.

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create multiple projects.
# Create a new Issue Type Scheme.
# Assign all project using the new issue type scheme
# Create a new issue and add a Sub-task within that issue.
# Move the Sub-task and choose "Change Issue Type".
# Click the drop down to select the Sub-task issue type.

*Result*:
* While the type of Issue Type is selectable, it is revealing the project name that have the same issue type scheme.

*Note*:
* This does not affect JIRA 6.4.7.
fields.summary: Change issue type: issue type select box contains project names

fields.description:
I tried referencing an image attached to a ticket within the ticket's description like so:

{code}
!PWEB-211_Excessive_whitespace.png|thumbnail!

!Excessive_whitespace.png|thumbnail!
{code}

If the file name contains a valid ticket number, that ticket number first gets rendered into a link, which then causes the image rendering to fail with this error message:

bq. Unable to render embedded object: File (PWEB-211_Excessive_whitespace.png) not found.
and PWEB-211 is a valid ticket in our system.
fields.summary: Image markdown parsing fails if file name contains a valid ticket.

Feel free to change the summary if this one isn't clear. This is the scenario:
Every now and then I do a 'spring-clean'. Remove obsolete workflows and other items.
To see the workflows I can delete I need to either collapse the Active panel or scroll down, then open the Inactive panel. After I click Delete the screen refreshes. To delete the next workflow I need to scroll down again and open the Inactive panel again.

It would be nice if Jira would remember the status of those panels, at least until I leave the page.
fields.summary: On the Workflows screen persist the panel status after an action

h3. Problem Definition
For JIRA with application links another application (eg. Fisheye, Stash, etc), it would be great if whenever there is a reference in a source code (eg. comments), there will be a link in the JIRA issue so the user can click on the link and be redirected to the source code. At the moment, it requires a commit to have a link. 

h3. Suggested Solution
This suggestion is for links to appear without having to commit anything.
fields.summary: Link to source code when there is a reference to a JIRA issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44242].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The feature we would like to have is to have an option to set this JNDI property in Jira User Directory LDAP configuration:
Property: java.naming.ldap.derefAliases
Setting values:
Property Setting	Description
always	Always dereference aliases.
never	Never dereferences aliases.
finding	Dereferences aliases only during name resolution.
searching	Dereferences aliases only after name resolution.


For further information: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/jndi/tutorial/ldap/misc/aliases.html
fields.summary: As an admin I would like to set the dereferencing property for my LDAP configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44240].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA is yet to properly support [aggregated group membership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/effective-memberships-with-multiple-directories-672530810.html] as currently obtained in Crowd Server and Confluence.
* JIRA requires that external groups that an external user belongs to are from the same directory as the user for this membership to be effective.
* Using the REST endpoint {{curl -H 'Content-type: application/json' -X PUT -d '{"membershipAggregationEnabled":true}' -u <username> <base-url>/rest/crowd/latest/application}} which works [in Confluence to turn on Aggregated group membership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/managing-multiple-directories-229838494.html#ManagingMultipleDirectories-NonAggregatingMembership] doesn't work in JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Support Aggregated group membership in JIRA Just like [available in Confluence since Confluence 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Upgrade+Notes#Confluence5.7UpgradeNotes-Changestohowgroupmembershipisdeterminedfrommultipleuserdirectories]. 

h3. Why this is important
This has an even higher value in JIRA since you can configure JIRA as your user server. Also migrating to Active Directory would become a lot easier. 

h3. Workaround 
* You may need to ensure relevant groups are in the same directory as the affected JIRA user.
fields.summary: Aggregated group membership
Having Project Summary Instead of Activity Stream

h3. Summary

When the Issue Navigator is loaded, it makes a call to the favourite filter resource, e.g.: https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/filter/favourite. {{FilterResource.getFavouriteFilters}} is currently inefficient such that it performs a lookup to retrieve every single user which is unnecessary and causes performance problems.

h3. Environment

* Java 8
* Database stats:
{code}

    <Comments>1535357</Comments>
    <Components>7276</Components>
    <Custom-Fields>576</Custom-Fields>

h3. Verification

Analysis of the thread dumps can indicate this is a problem, for example searching for the amount of threads in that filter method, specifically:

{noformat}
grep FilterResource.getFavouriteFilters *threads*  |awk '{print $1}' |sort |uniq -c
  29 jira_threads.1436473916.txt:
  31 jira_threads.1436473932.txt:
  28 jira_threads.1436473946.txt:
  29 jira_threads.1436473960.txt:
  29 jira_threads.1436473974.txt:
  31 jira_threads.1436473988.txt:
{noformat}

This shows us there's roughly 30 threads in each of those thread dumps that are calling this method, and this is likely a problem. Further investigation into the dumps and matching them with the stack trace above will verify it as a cause.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44234].
  {panel}

Hello,
Today, even with the recent JIRA version it’s not easy and safe to operate a change of Labels in bulk mode: When your items are tagged with several various labels - which labels are made for-  it can be really risky to update them in bulk because you may overwrite some existing labels with your new one. In order to avoid that, you have no choice but doing the update operation by groups of items that have identical labels values.

Illustrating with a simple example:
Let say you have the 3 following JIRA items (of course real use cases involve more issues) tagged with these labels: 

* Item J-XX2:    Labels= [ADEPT][Cont.Delivery][Quikwin]
* Item J-XX13:  Labels=[ADEPT]
* Item J-XX27:  Labels= [ADEPT] [PP] [Quikwin]
* …

… and say you need to tag these [ADEPT] items with an additional label [Candidate].
Well, currently you just can’t use the bulk mode for that and update these 3 items in one operation. (As you would necessarily overwrite existing labels values). What you need to do then is to identify items with similar labels and bulk edit them, retyping the existing labels plus the one that you need to add... Quite painful not to say hazardous in practice.

So I'm thinking it would really empower the Labelling feature in JIRA, if we could simply append or remove a label value on a selection of issues (no matter the various labels actually set currently for each one of these)

Thanks for considering this suggestion.
Stephane
fields.summary: Support the Append / Remove mode in bulk edition for the "Labels" field.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Some Issue Types, such as Epic and Story, indicate that they should not be edited however there is nothing which prevents that from occurring.
!IssueTypes.png|thumbnail!

Use case:
Customer edited the Epic Issue Type to "New Type."  If viewing an Agile Scrum Backlog, "New Type" is not displayed as Epics are Hidden from the Backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a "locking" feature similar to non-editable System Fields to prevent these Issue Types from being edited
 
h3. Workaround 
Update the modified Epic Issue Type back to "Epic" and create a New Issue Type
fields.summary: Lock Issue Types From Being Edited

fields.description:
We are experiencing some occasional problems when creating issues in regards to scripted post-functions. There are two ways to create issues:

# Click the "Create" button and use the in-window popup. *We do _not_ experience any issues when creating issues like this.*
# Right-click the "Create" button to open the Create window in a new window/tab. This is how users created issues prior to JIRA 5.0. When we create issues like this, we see that scripted post-functions are skipped entirely.

We create rather a lot of issues using method #2 due to a plugin that we use - after some testing and working with the plugin provider (SuiTest), we've ruled out that there are *not* any issues with the plugin and it appears that scripted post-functions are skipped when using method #2 whether or not the plugin is installed.
fields.summary: Scripted post-functions should not be skipped at issue creation.

h3. Summary
When using IE11 in JIRA, selecting the calendar under customfield type date picker in issue navigator will generate the following error:
{{You must enter text with 15 or fewer characters}}
h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.7, JIRA Software 7.1.4 / 7.1.7
* Internet Explorer 11

# Create a customfield with date time picker type
# Then go to issue navigator select the customfield you had just created

The respective date is selected.

h3. Actual Results
The error message below will be shown: {{You must enter text with 15 or fewer characters}}

* Use Advance Searching

fields.description:
h3. Actual Results:

When trying to order the issue search results by the {{Issues > Search for Issues > Detailed View > Order by}} button, the custom fields of the type Data Picker are not displayed.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a custom field of the type Date Picker
# Go to _Issues > Search for Issues > Detailed View > Order by_
# Click the down triangle button besides the Order by button
# Try to select the custom field created (by typing its name)
# Expected result: Should not be possible to select the custom field

h3. Expected Results:

The date picker custom field should be available from the button Order by, since it can be referenced by the statement  'ORDER BY <custom field>' from JQL.

h3. Workaround:

# Click the advanced search
# Create a search with the order by statement referencing the data picker custom field, like:
  {code}
  ORDER BY "custom field name"
  {code}
# Perform the search
# The Order by button should assume the form: _Order by <custom field name>_
# Should be possible to switch to the basic search if you search is simple
fields.summary: The Order by button does not show custom fields of the type Date Picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44207].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In a few aspects of JIRA e.g. User Profile menu (my JIRA home, logout menu items), the atl_token is appended to the URL and propagated using GET method.

_Sensitive information such as token will travel as part of URL when using GET. This information will be stored in browser cache and server logs. This information will be available for unauthorized disclosure through various methods such as shoulder surfing, shared machines or accessing server logs. Additionally, URLs information can get leaked out using referrer header when an external link is accessed via the application._

h3. Suggested Solution
POST method can be used instead, since it doesn't store the token as part of the URL and perhaps appears to expose less.
fields.summary: atl_token appended to request URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44195].
  {panel}

I often have meetings relating to this or that JIRA Task, Story, Epic, etc.,  I keep track of the meeting and follow-ups in Confluence, creating Confluence tasks as I go.  Often these tasks relate directly to a JIRA ticket.  It would be very convenient to have an easy way to view all Confluence tasks that relate to this or that JIRA ticket within said ticket (rather than creating a link manually in the Confluence document, and then clicking on the resulting link in JIRA to see if there were any tasks that relate to the JIRA ticket).

Maybe this could involve a specialized Confluence Macro, identifying a JIRA ticket that will display all the tasks in the Confluence page (with the ability to check said tasks in the JIRA ticket), as well as link type in JIRA that would identify individual Confluence records whose tasks will be brought into the JIRA ticket.

Finally, it would be good to have a separate area for Confluence tasks within the JIRA ticket - maybe something like the areas for the lists of linked tickets and sub-tasks that are currently found in JIRA tickets.

I created a ticket in the Confluence project for this functionality -  [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38209] for this functionality.

Thanks,

Daniel.
fields.summary: Allow for the inclusion of Confluence Tasks within a JIRA ticket

fields.description:
Maybe this is as designed with the new administration screen/panel, however it is easily reproducible and at a minimum should have some better handling. 

Issue: 
1. Select a project with no existing Agile Board from the Projects Tab.
2. Note URL contains the correct project key.
3. Navigation will go to a completely unrelated Agile board, but the correct key is still displayed.
4. Select the admin Cog at the bottom of the left panel. 
5. Incorrect summary is displayed.
6. Refresh will yield the proper summary page. 

Work Around:
1. Create an Agile board tied to the existing project.
fields.summary: Projects Tab selected project leads to different project page when no agile board exists

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44193].
  {panel}

As a PO, I want to easily collect suggestions from my products' sales & support personnel to have feedback from people working "in the trenches".


Although plain JIRA can be shoehorned into a suggestions management system, the result is nowhere near as convenient as the solution proposed on your [HipChat support page|https://help.hipchat.com/forums/138883-suggestions-ideas].

I don't need a solution as comprehensive as one would get by having the UserVoice/Plugin/JIRA bundle (I could not justify the cost for an internal use), but something that would give me:
* An issue collector gadget with search box & instant results (to avoid duplications)
* A workflow add-on (to get a quick-start)
* An economic voting system (with votes returning once the suggestion is closed)
* linked-issues triggers (ability to transition one issue based on a transition from a linked issue)

Would be just good enough.
fields.summary: As a PO I want to easily collect suggestions from my products' sales & support personnel

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44191].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA hangs when Edit button is clicked. This happens when all fields are removed from the Edit Screen. 


h3. Environment
* Delete all fields from Edit Screen
* !screen1.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project
# Go to the project's project administration page > Screens > Click on Edit Issue Screen
# Remove all fields from Edit Issue screen
# Create issue from this project
# Click on Edit button


h3. Expected Results
# Have the same behavior as if the user has no edit permissions in the project permission scheme: No EDIT button and nothing if we use the 'e' shortcut

h3. Actual Results
# Loading icon shows non stop 
!screen2.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Hit the *Esc* button from the keyboard
fields.summary: Edit button causes JIRA to hang when Edit issue screen does not contain any field

h3. Problem Definition

We have certain situations where opening up a new issue can only happen if it is linked to a previous issue (things like tuning). I know the linking issue is optional but have the ability to make it required would be beneficial.
  
h3. Suggested Solution

Have a feature where Administrator will be able to define if Issue Linking is mandatory for certain issue type in a project.
fields.summary: Making Linking an issue mandatory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44186].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently, sub-tasks can only be filtered by 'Show Open' or 'Show All'. I would like to request that we can filter the tasks if a string in the sub-task title matches the filter.

For example, where I work, I work on tickets for fixing website bugs. This part of the QA process. There's a master ticket labelled "Client Name QA", and then there are sub-tasks for each QA bug.

The sub tasks are named with their relevant department, and the issue, like so:

PM - blah blah
CSS - Blah blah
Dev - Blah Blah

Me, handling tasks for CSS, would only like to see the ones relevant to me, so I think it would be beneficial that I could only show subtasks which have CSS in the title.

So the logical way of seeing it would be something like: If 'title' contains 'CSS', display, else hide. I know it's not that simple, but that's where I'm getting at!

Thanks in advance guys,
Ash
fields.summary: Add feature to filter sub-tasks by title

fields.description:

Currently, the new Pie Chart graphics hides elements in the "Other" category if there are too many sections on the pie chart. Example: 
!PieChartExpand.png|thumbnail!
You would have to hover your mouse over it to show the other elements. 

We should have an Expand feature where clicking on the "Other" element would *expand* the list and show all values, instead of having it as a popup panel. This allows people to screenshot the *entire table* and put it in their own reports.
fields.summary: Expand option for the Other category in a pie chart instead of a popup panel

fields.description:

# Add a pie chart gadget to the dashboard. The new pie chart looks like this: 
!PieChartNew.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
A developer entered the description
      The beach profile length (distance it goes offshore) must be >= 100m.

This was silently changed to
      The beach profile length (distance it goes offshore) must be = 100m.

Note : The actual original message contained the symbol for >= but JIRA won't display it and converts it into an equals sign when saved.

Can this please be investigated? It has the potential to occur frequently as some of our users are taking requirements from word documents using symbols and putting them into JIRA descriptions. As a work around we are using >= but this is not always necessarily being captured.

Thanks
fields.summary: JIRA symbol encoding issue

fields.description:
When the default author of a mailhandler is inactive, JIRA will consume incoming emails without creating new issues or comments.
The emails are deleted without any action from the mailbox and therefore are lost.
fields.summary: Mailhandler deletes mail without creating new issue or comment when default author is inactive

fields.description:
When a user is creating a link on a JIRA issue to another issue, confluence page or any other link, he may include as well a comment for that link. The expectation of a user is normally, that this comment will be displayed beside the link that is included in the link section, or may be shown when the link is "expanded". 

The comment to that link is only included in the comments section. It has no reference any more to the link it was created with. This leads to funny situations, when someone creates a link, comments it, and users get the notification for the comment (only) and don't see the newly created link (which is part of the story).

It would be nice, if

* The link had the option to show the comment nearby, so there may be additional information besides the title and the link itself.
* The comment would be removed from the comments section when included as part of the link.
fields.summary: Comments for JIRA Links are not "linked" to the link after creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44166].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Formatting is changed the moment the user paste on IE 10 and above. 

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Create a description with the following format (verified from the database):
{code}
 \r
 \r
 Test Issue,\r
 \r
 Check if the return carriage is taking effect.\r
 \r
 Especially using IE 10\r
 \r
 Check\r
{code}
# Copy from the description field
# Paste it to the comment box at the comment field
# Click Save

h3. Expected Behavior

Retain the formatting

h3. Actual Behavior

It is saved with:
{noformat}
 Test Issue,\r
 Check if the return carriage is taking effect.\r
 Especially using IE 10\r
 Check\r
{noformat}
(i) You will notice during the pasting, the carriage return (\r) is removed 

h3. Additional Information

There are cases, where the carriage return is removed entirely. And return as:
{noformat}
Test Issue, Check if the return carriage is taking effect. Especially using IE 10 Check
{noformat}
(i) However, this cannot be reproduce reliably using VMAC
fields.summary: Pasting Text In IE10 Removes the Carriage Return

fields.description:
h4. Summary
OAuth token is referring to the old URL after recreating the Application Link between JIRA and Confluence

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.1.5
Confluence 5.7

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Application Link directly between JIRA and Confluence
# Link Confluence page into JIRA issue and put this JIRA issue key into the linked page
# Authenticate the link to trigger token creation between JIRA and Confluence
# Stop Confluence
# Setup Confluence over SSL
# Start Confluence
# Remove Application Link in both JIRA and Confluence
# Re-create Application Link to run through the SSL connector
# OAuth token has been removed. So, attempt to generate a new token by authenticating the link from JIRA issue and from the Confluence page

(i) This can also be reproduced without configuring SSL, by changing the Base URL for example.

h4. Expected Results
OAuth token in JIRA is referring to the new URL, over HTTPS (SSL)
!correctURL.png|thumbnail!

h4. Actual Results
OAuth token in JIRA is referring to the old URL, HTTP
!incorrectURL.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
Token from the Confluence side is generated correctly.
!confluence.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
- Follow the steps to remove the Application Links directly from the database in both JIRA and Confluence:
-- [How to remove Application link directly through JIRA database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+remove+Application+link+directly+through+JIRA+database]
-- See resolution section on [Application Link configuration cannot be deleted via the UI and appears as System Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Application+Link+configuration+cannot+be+deleted+via+the+UI+and+appears+as+System+Link] for Confluence
fields.summary: OAuth token is referring to the old URL in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a custom field is present in one of the projects and not in others, then "ORDER BY" in issue navigator seems broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 projects with different field configurations
# Add a numeric type custom field in one project only. Make it non-mandatory. I used the field called (Priority #) on my testing.
# Now create a few issues on both projects.
# Create some issues without the custom field filled out.
# Now search for the issues on the issue navigator order by the custom field.

h3. Expected Results
Issues where the custom field is not filled in or not present will show up first and then the issues where the custom field is filled in.

h3. Actual Results
The issues created in the project where the custom field is not present show up first. Then the issues from the other project where the custom field is project. Lastly issues from the project where the custom field is present but is not filled in. See attached screenshot.
 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time but for now you could order by another field in your searches if possible.
fields.summary: As a user I see that the search ordering is not working correctly when a field is present in one of the projects context but not in others

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Indexes page only tells the Jira Administrator if there is a background/foreground re-indexing running at the time. No other details such as when or who trigger the previous re-indexing is stored anywhere.


h3. Suggested Solution
Include the details of every re-indexing change in the [Audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/auditing-in-jira-applications-938847740.html], including it start and completion
* Date of the re-indexing triggered
* Author/User that triggers the re-indexing
* Category: Re-indexing start/completed
* Type: Project/Background/Foreground re-indexing
* Node: (For Data Center) indicate which node triggers the re-indexing

h3. Why this is important
* With bug such as [JRASERVER-47045|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47045], having information of when a re-indexing is start/complete is useful to easily understand the status of the instance/node.
* Helps understand if a node is running a re-indexing at the time
 
h3. Workaround 
- Proceed to {{JIRA HOME > Cache > Indexes}}
- Check when last this folder was modified.
fields.summary: Record Last Index information (date/time) in Jira Audit log

fields.description:
*Summary*

Some company only required a project template/type to be shown in the project type creation window so they disable the following modules:
- jira-sample-item, jira-issuetracking and jira-perfectmanagement-item in JIRA Core Project Template Plugin
- jira-software-development-project-template in JIRA For Software Plugin
- Agile Scrum (not od one) and Agile Kanban (not od one) in JIRA Agile Marketing Plugin
(i) Only left *Project Default Schemes* template are showing in the window.

After selected the desired project template, the *height of the window is not rendering correctly*. 

For example:
!project-type.png|width=500,height=100!
!project-height-rendering.png|width=500,height=100!

*Finding*

It seems the project type window height has a dependency with the *JIRA Agile Marketing plugin*. When disabling the *Agile Scrum* or *Agile Kanban* module, we will see the problem.
fields.summary: Improvement for adjusting new project type window height
Ability to Filter Custom Fields

fields.description:
There is no method to manage user status when "Manage User Status Locally" is enabled in a JIRA User Directory. This causes problems where a user in JIRA is inactive and cannot be made active in JIRA or in the remote directory.

h4. Example:
* Test user is disabled in remote directory
* Add new User Directory to JIRA with "Manage User Status Locally" selected
* After first full synchronization, test user appears in JIRA and is inactive
** Note there is no method to make this user active
* Make user active in remote directory
* Initiate synchronization of user directory
* User remains inactive
** This applies to both full and incremental synchronizations

To make user active and to make all user status controlled by remote directory:
* Edit User Directory to disable "Manage User Status Locally"
* Save User Directory configuration
* Click Synchronize to initiate synchronization
* User status will now be controlled by remote directory

Tested with Active Directory Connector in JIRA 6.3.14, 6.4.7, and 7.0.0
fields.summary: Manage User Status Locally does not provide option to manage user status
Possibility to make different priorities for different projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is installing JIRA and Selects upgrade, when they get to the page with the link to Backing up JIRA documentation, clicking on the link sends them to the wrong page.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA using installer
# Select Upgrade option when asked if you want to install or upgrade as described in [our rapid upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Using+a+Rapid+Upgrade+Method](Step 6.b.)
# On the page for *Upgrade Check List*, click on the link {{backup your JIRA Database}}

h3. Expected Results
- User sees the [correct documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Backing+Up+Data] that would guide them through backing up their database.

h3. Actual Results
- The link leads them to a page not found page.
fields.summary: Wrong Documentation From Installer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user has the 'Edit Issue' screen open, he/she is not aware of changes made to the same issue by another user. By choosing 'Update' the user will be overwriting the changes made by the other user. Fields that were empty but have since been filled are emptied again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce ( Example scenario )
# At 10:00 am User A opens the edit screen for an issue and but gets called to a meeting. He leaves the issue in the edit screen view. 
# At 10:30 am User B opens the same issue, fills in the Description & Label field then clicks on Update.
# At 11:00 am User A returns to her computer, alters only the description field but leaves the label field empty and clicks on Update.

h3. Expected Results
User A should get some kind of warning or notification that the values of the issue has been changed of that the new values will be merged with the values entered by User B ( something like how Confluence works )

h3. Actual Results
Changes made by User A overwrites changes made by User B without any knowledge of both the users. The description field now only has values from User A and the label field  is now empty.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Reducing the [default timeout session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+session+timeout] was suggested but not really  feasible
fields.summary: JIRA should not allow users to overwrite information added or changed after the Edit Screen was opened.
As an administrator I would like to see examples about POST,PUT and DELETE REST requests using OAuth
